intro: Telanthera floridana, commonly known as the Florida telanthera, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and wetlands. Telanthera floridana is often found in open habitats and is adapted to the warm, humid climate of its native range.
